text:
*appending hidden fields to a HubSpot form*
I have a strange issue. When appending hidden fields to a HubSpot form to update custom contact properties it is all working fine until I have a contact property which has both a double underline and ends in an underline for example:

and on the HubSpot form I append a hidden field like:

```<input name="question__why_does_this_field_not_update_" value="sadface">```
If I format the internal name to not have the double underline or the ending underline then it works fine…
What are you trying to accomplish? There are a handful of things you can do — mostly it revolves around splitting JS up into pieces and locating them in the correct place.
Hi BJ. An FAQ accordion module that creates FAQ schema. Sometimes people use the module twice and it creates two schema script blocks that throws errors in search console.
What do you mean by FAQ schema? How are you using JS for the module? Can’t you create the FAQ accordion via hubl + html and then use JS to power the click events?
<script type="application/ld+json"> it creates a script tag. So no real js functions. It could also be require_head but would be nice to have require_once like php
What is inside of that script tag? It’s unique to each module? Or is it the same between them all?
